org.jcvi.jillion.trace.sff

Class SffUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.trace.sff.SffUtil

  • public final class SffUtil
extends Object
    Utility class for working with sff encoded data.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SffUtil.Linkers
      Mated Sff reads contain both mate data in the same read with a "linker" sequence in between.

    • Field Summary

      static byte FORMAT_CODE

      • computeTrimRangeFor

        public static Range computeTrimRangeFor(SffFlowgram flowgram)
        Compute the trim Range that should be used for this SffFlowgram. This method uses the values from both SffFlowgram.getQualityClip() and SffFlowgram.getAdapterClip() using the algorithm described in the sff file format documentation: 
         (pseudocode)
 trimRange =   
      Range.of(CoordinateSystem.RESIDUE_BASED,
           max(1, max(clip_qual_left, clip_adapter_left)),
           min( (clip_qual_right == 0 ? number_of_bases : clip_qual_right), (clip_adapter_right == 0 ? number_of_bases : clip_adapter_right) )
        Parameters:
        flowgram - the SffFlowgram to get the trim range of; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a Range representing the trimRange to use.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if flowgram is null.
        See Also:
        sff file specification

      • computeTrimRangeFor

        public static Range computeTrimRangeFor(SffReadHeader readHeader)
        Compute the trim Range that should be used for this SffReadHeader. This method uses the values from both SffReadHeader.getQualityClip() and SffReadHeader.getAdapterClip() using the algorithm described in the sff file format documentation: 
         (pseudocode)
 trimRange =   
      Range.of(CoordinateSystem.RESIDUE_BASED,
           max(1, max(clip_qual_left, clip_adapter_left)),
           min( (clip_qual_right == 0 ? number_of_bases : clip_qual_right), (clip_adapter_right == 0 ? number_of_bases : clip_adapter_right) )
        Parameters:
        readHeader - the SffReadHeader to get the trim range of; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a Range representing the trimRange to use.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if readHeader is null.
        See Also:
        sff file specification
